TopicTitle: How long did you play the demo for...

Articles.Content:
...before you bought the full version?

For me, it was within 20mins. In that short time, I knew this was the game I had been waiting for! I haven't put it down since!

Roughly ten minutes. A friend told me about it in the morning, I skeptically downloaded the demo in the evening, spent five minutes doing something basic in the VAB, opened the map view and... Planets. Planets everywhere. Quickly headed off to the said friend's house to see the full game then came back home to buy it. Worth it.

...before you bought the full version?

For me, it was within 20mins. In that short time, I knew this was the game I had been waiting for! I haven't put it down since!

A bit under 4 hours. I knew it was a keeper in about the same time as you, but I set myself the goal of getting a kerbal into orbit before purchasing the full game. Bought it the same night I downloaded and installed the demo, then stayed up all night playing the full version.
About 8 months, between July 2011 and March 2012.
I have never used the demo. The second I first found this game, I knew it was for me, and bought it instantly.
1 week. I would have brought it sooner, I just had to learn the basic controls.
October 2011 until 0.14 came out.
I was here before the demo existed. But I guess I could say that I played until 0.14 came out that's when I bought the game.
A couple days in late September 2011.
Not sure, max 2 hours. Bought it the same evening.

Saw a post on Reddit with a screen shot.

Demo was installed within 10 mins.

Full version was purchased and installed 30 mins after that.

Sometimes you just know a game has 'me' written all over it.
About an hour... got a rocket to a stable orbit and that's all she wrote.
A day. I managed to crash into the Mun, then I knew it was time.
I spent about 8 hours playing it... Or about one Saturday.

0 seconds.

Bought the game before I tested it. Worth it!
Saw someone mentioned the game online, downloaded the demo, played it for about 24 hours, then got the full version
from the release of the original demo to late .18

Glad to see so many people share similar instances. As soon as I built a rocket that resembled the Shinra No. 26 and spectacularly crashed it, I bought it. It took me a day, but only because I needed to sleep between a heavy demo session and getting the game. I got it just as 0.17 was released.
An afternoon + evening, not sure how much time that is but I did all 4 tutorials and built a few rockets. I bought the game late in the evening.
I never even got the demo. Went straight to the full version, money well spent.
About a year, played both demos and eventually bought 18.4

For a few months. I got the full version in May and the demo sometime in March or February. I may have gotten it sooner if I wasn't as nervous to ask my parents to buy it and knew that the game wouldn't be completely unplayable due to lag in the full version.
